title: 820-00138 no image
message:
I have an 820-00138 that had corrosion around the display connector area, and had no image. After a quick clean with alcohol and a toothbrush, I was able to get an image, but the area needed to be touched up to be reliable, and replacement of the LVDS connector and display cable was also needed. I replaced necessary filters and resistors in this are and replaced the connector and cable. Unfortunately, now I am unable to get an image. I have the boardview file but the backlight circuit and associated capacitors/resistors on the schematic do not match the corresponding components on the actual board, so this makes it difficult to diagnose. I have been using the 820-00163 boardview wich seems to have the correct component layout, minus the backlight circuit. The display has been verfied to function correctly, just not with this board. Here are my diode readings from the display connector:

1: 1.258
2: OL
3: .562
4: .560
5: .709
6: 1.827
7: 1.790
8: .743
9: OL
10: OL
11: OL
12: OL
13: GND
14: OL
15: OL
16: GND
17: OL
18: OL
19: GND
20: OL
21: OL
22: GND
23: OL
24: OL
25: GND
26: GND
27: GND
28: .588
29: .588
30: .588

All of these measurements were taken with the display disconnected

Now what I noticed between this board and the 820-00163 board is that pins 9 (LCD_HPD-CONN) and 10 (LCD_FSS)  have a reading of .643 and .699 respectively. I followed these lines to the corresponding resistors on the board (820-00163) and the resistors were not shorted and measured good. Just as of note, the backlight would occasionally come on during testing but no image was displayed. What might the issue be?

title: 820-00138 no image
message: LCD_HPD is high @ 3.31V with display connected

title: 820-00138 no image
message:
Check FL8300-03 continuity.
Also check their traces to J8300 and C8320-27.
Be sure all the caps are good, including C8238/39.
